instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no trackpa/keyboard
threads.message:
hi ,
 liquid damage repaired , new keyboard  and new connector fitted , worked for few days and then lost the kb/trackpad . replaced <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> and it started working but again no trackpad / kb after few hours kindly advise

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no trackpa/keyboard
threads.message: Corroded <RESISTOR>R5701</RESISTOR>/2/4 or traces to/from them, so no 3V to <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>.
